an4.200:2.2: I found BBs translation hard to parse: I have tried to render the various nagations and clauses more clearly.
an4.200:4.2: This is a good example of how negative terms must have a positive force. If you merely don’t love someone, you don’t care what anyone thinks about them.
an4.200:8.3: For usseneti I follow CPD, this is the natural reading. For the last three factors I see a thematic continuity: one “fumes” from an internal heating, “is ignited” by some external cause, and “burns up” when these catch on. Surely we should trace sampajjhayati to jhayati2 here; the exact term doesn’t seem to occur elsewhere.
